Cube Title: Number of students in regular programs for youth, public elementary and secondary schools, by Indigenous identity, grade and sex
Archive Status: CURRENT - a cube available to the public and that is current

Cube Title: not available for a specific reference period

value rounded to 0 (zero) where there is a meaningful distinction between true zero and the value that was rounded

Product Id: All counts are randomly rounded to a multiple of 3 using the following procedure: counts that are already a multiple of 3 are not adjusted; counts 1 greater than a multiple of 3 are adjusted to the next lowest multiple of 3 with a probability of two-thirds and to the next highest multiple of 3 with a probability of one-third. The probabilities are reversed for counts that are 1 less than a multiple of 3.
The data are subject to revision.
Counts represent the number of students enrolled in programs at the beginning of the school year (in September or as close as possible thereafter).
Totals may not add up to the sum of all categories due to rounding.

Data are reported for off-reserve public schools. In the Elementary-Secondary Education Survey, public elementary and secondary schools are publicly funded schools that are operated by school boards or the province/territory.
The Canada totals reflect data from the reporting provinces and territories.

CANSIM Id: Indigenous identity" may not equal the sum of the four other categories. When more than one Indigenous identity was reported
URL: the student was counted in each appropriate group
Cube Notes: but only once in the totals."

Product Id: Indigenous identity" refers to the three Indigenous groups recognized by the Canadian Constitution: First Nations (North American Indian)
URL: and Inuit (Inuk). First Nations (North American Indian) includes both Status and Non-Status Indians."

CANSIM Id: group not reported" includes instances where a student was reported as Indigenous but a group was not specified."

Product Id: “Grade not reported” includes instances where a student is not considered to be in a specific grade or where the student’s grade is not known.
